newsitem.title: USA: Ford puts first-ever incentive on '97 Taurus.
newsitem.headline: Ford puts first-ever incentive on '97 Taurus.

text.p: Ford Motor Co has added further incentives to its Taurus, including a first-ever $500 rebate on 1997 models of the car, dealers said Monday.

On 1996 models, Ford gave dealers an option of another $1,000 cash rebate to be passed on to consumers, or a five percent increase in the dealer incentive. The 1996 models already have cash-back incentives of $1,500.
In addition, Ford is offering an additional $500 rebate for people who turn in a 1990-1994 model Taurus for a new one.
The U.S. No. 2 automaker also put a $500 incentive on the 1997 Escort. The new programs go into effect on October 2.
Ford told dealers about the new programs late last week. A Ford spokeswoman confirmed there are new incentives coming for the Taurus. She could not be later reached for comment on specific terms.
The Taurus, the best-selling car in the U.S. for 1995, had sold 250,212 units through the first eight months of 1996, 1,409 fewer than the Accord from Honda Motor Co.
